title: Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 getting an animated sequel in Amazon's new Secret Level series
description: Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2 has only been out a couple of months, but already a sequel's on the horizon - albeit not in the way you might immediately assume. Games Workshop has confirmed Warhammer 40K's appearance in Amazon's upcoming Secret Level series will take the form of an animated Space Marine 2 sequel. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1 & 2 Remastered enhancements include map, compass, and more
description: It's been a couple of month since Crystal Dynamics revealed its beloved dark fantasy action-adventures Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1 & 2 were poised to get the remaster treatment. And now, with the two-game bundle's December release looming, remaster developer Aspyr has detailed a few of the enhancements the spruce-ups will bring. Read more

title: Both Arcane: League Of Legends Steelbook Editions Get Big, Limited-Time Amazon Discounts
description: Arcane Limited Edition Steelbook on 4K Blu-ray (Season 1) $41 (was $60) See at Amazon Arcane Limited Edition Steelbook on Blu-ray (Season 1) $37.33 (was $55) See at Amazon (Steelbook) See at Amazon (Standard) The Art and Making of Arcane (Hardcover Book) $54 (was $60) See at Amazon Season 1 of Arcane: League of Legends released on 4K and standard Blu-ray earlier this month with a pair of limited editions, and Amazon is already offering big discounts on both. These are limited-time Amazon deals, so you'll want to snag them as soon as possible. Arcane's 4K Limited Edition Steelbook is available for only $41 (was $60), while the standard Blu-ray Limited Edition Steelbook is discounted to $37.33 (was $55). That means you can get both for roughly $88 (was $115). And big Arcane fans may actually want both, because each steelbook features one of the main characters: Jinx (4K) or Vi (1080p).With the second and final season of Arcane set to premiere on Netflix on November 2, it's the perfect time to watch the stellar animated show. See all Arcane Season 1 Physical Editions Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 853
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Are you contemplating any limited edition holiday makeup releases? I usually prefer products in the permanent collections because in my experience holiday makeup performs differently for whatever reason. I do love a holiday fragrance set, though! 2. Are BB creams worth your time? My answer was no back in the day, but now that I’m into minimal base, I’m thinking it could be good if I find one that agrees with my skin. Hmm, maybe that will be my next makeup project – finding “the one.” I stumbled onto this one by Dr. Jart and it looks pretty good. 3. Your favorite video game? It’s all about old school Tetris on a Gameboy, baby! 4.Advice you wish you would’ve received as a young person? I wish someone[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 853 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 834
description: Yup, it’s officially fall around here, and Rosie’s soaking it in. Tabs would have been bustin’ out the scarves already! As you know, this is a great time of year for feline fashion. Rosie’s also a big fan… Tabs did some of his most memorable kitty modeling campaigns for fall, including his award-winning Autumn Leaves tutorial, which set the standard for feline makeup infographics for years to come. Rosie has kept the fall vibes going here at Tabs the Cat Industries, LLC, but Tabs was the cat who blazed the trail. Jeez, that swagger, those eyes, those markings… Simply incredible. 🙂 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 834 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: You can bone the Grim Reaper in The Sims 4 now
description: The Grim Reaper has long been the forbidden lover in The Sims 4, but that’s changing ahead of the game’s new Life & Death expansion pack. Ahead of the expansion’s release date on Oct. 31, The Sims 4 developer Maxis published a free base game update that adds a bunch of ghostly goodies to the […]

title: Arcane’s stunning season 1 collector’s edition is now available
description: Arcane, the Netflix animated series based on League of Legends, is now available on physical media in a variety of editions ahead of the launch of its second season. For big fans of the show, the physical collector’s edition might appeal most to you. It includes a trio of 4K Blu-ray discs containing all nine […]
author: Alice Jovanée

title: Former Skyrim developer's heavy metal open world hunting sim releases on Steam
description: Did you have a fine old time in Blackreach, the mazy, Dwemer-built underside of Skyrim's sprawling mountain map? Do you like murdering Ents in slow motion? Do you want to see smells? You might be interested in The Axis Unseen, which has just launched on Steam - it's the work of former Bethesda developer Nate Purkeypile, one of the big brains behind Blackreach. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Here's a free god sim from the Shotgun King devs in which you Build The Sun
description: Shotgun King developers Punkcake Délicieux have quietly rolled out another ticklish oddity in the shape of Build The Sun, a work-in-progress 2D god sim. In Build The Sun you preside over a tribe of alarming yet cute inkblot creatures, who sometimes remind me of Pikmin and sometimes, of that awful 'roided-up panther monster from the opening stretch of Another World. Your objective is, indeed, to build the sun, because there isn't one: the game's pastoral pixelart world is engulfed in darkness. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
